items.title: Learn Embedded Linux using Yocto Project

visible_instructors.job_title: Embedded Software Engineer at RFI Wireless ,Sydney,Australia
visible_instructors.title: Sonu Abraham
visible_instructors.name: Sonu

items.headline: Learn Embedded Linux development using Raspberry Pi, Beaglebone Black or qemux86 emulator and Yocto Project
objectives_summary: This course  has been designed to help you understand how to use the Yocto Project tools to manage key components of a Linux distribution: toolchains, bootloaders, kernels and package management systems. You will learn how to use a Yocto Project based toolchain and tools to develop, debug and test your software, as well as how to use Yocto to customize and maintain an Embedded Linux distribution for multiple boards.
Students will be able to apply the techinques used in the course with other Embedded Linux based projects.
Students will be able to develop , test , debug embedded Linux systems using yocto project.

items.title: Active Directory on Windows Server 2016 Best Practices

objectives_summary: Install, manage, administer and apply best practices to a Windows Active Directory

items.title: Linux 2021: Linux for Beginners

visible_instructors.job_title: Web & Mobile Development, IOS, Android, Ethical Hacking, IT
visible_instructors.name: Oak
visible_instructors.title: Oak Academy

items.headline: Learn Linux, use Ubuntu on Linux and begin your Linux journey. You will find everyhing about Linux on this linux course
objectives_summary: Linux has a somewhat inaccurate reputation as being a much more technical and complex alternative to mainstay operating systems like Windows and MacOS.
Linux is available in a range of different distributions that are tailored to the needs and skill of their users.
Linux is an operating system (OS), which is the primary software that a computer uses to execute tasks and communicate directions to its hardware.
